adjective.description: (of an argument, theory, or policy) logical and consistent.
examples: they failed to develop a coherent economic strategy

adjective.description: United as or forming a whole.
examples: divided into a number of geographically coherent kingdoms

adjective.description: (of waves) having a constant phase relationship.

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense logically related to): from Latin cohaerent- sticking together, from the verb cohaerere (see cohere).
